decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Combo by using cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to search for key pieces such as Allosaurus Rider and Griselbrand. The deck also utilizes cards like Summoner's Pact and Pact of Negation to protect the combo and ensure it goes off smoothly. Additionally, the deck includes various support cards like Generous Ent and Disciple of Freyalise to generate mana and ramp into the combo pieces faster. Overall, the main goal of the deck is to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to aggressively swarm the board with creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while using cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge to deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes powerful Planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and enchantments like Arena of Glory to enhance the creatures and maintain board control. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy that combines creature-based attacks with direct damage spells.

This UW Control deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Isochron Scepter to reuse powerful instant spells like Counterspell and Path to Exile. The deck aims to maintain control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage provided by cards like Tune the Narrative and Consult the Star Charts. The goal is to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage and powerful late-game spells.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the powerful UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to ramp up mana quickly and cast big colorless threats like Karn, the Great Creator, Thought-Knot Seer, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck runs board wipes like All Is Dust and targeted removal like Dismember to control the game while also generating advantage with cards like Sowing Mycospawn. The sideboard likely includes artifacts to tutor with Karn and additional interaction to customize the deck for specific matchups.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly build a wide board presence with aggressive creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Guide of Souls, supported by powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer. The deck also includes disruption elements like Static Prison and Goblin Bombardment to control the opponent's board. The mana base is optimized for consistency with fetch lands and dual lands, allowing for a smooth curve of aggressive plays. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies and controlling the board while also quickly applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Utilizing a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and graveyard hate, the deck aims to disrupt opponent's plans while building a threatening board presence. The creatures in the deck are versatile and resilient, allowing for different angles of attack. The deck also includes some land hate cards to further disrupt opponents' mana base. Overall, the strategy of the deck is to keep opponents off balance and gradually chip away at their life total.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying constant pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board, while also utilizing cards like Solitude and Ephemerate for removal and protection, this deck aims to create a difficult board state for the opponent to navigate. With a mix of disruptive elements and efficient threats, the deck aims to overload the opponent's resources and take control of the game through attrition and aggression.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using various cards to generate mana or disrupt the opponent's plays. By casting spells like Whir of Invention and Lotus Bloom, along with utilizing creatures like Fallaji Archaeologist and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to quickly build up resources and then utilize Goblin Charbelcher to deal massive damage in a single turn. With a mix of counterspells and control elements, the deck seeks to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up for a game-winning finale.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also includes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to help control the board and apply pressure. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Thraben Charm provide additional versatility and utility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while maintaining control of the battlefield.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate significant mana advantage to quickly ramp into Primeval Titan and other powerful threats. It utilizes lands like Lotus Field and Urza's Saga to generate additional resources and enable explosive plays, while also including utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures for protection. The deck aims to set up and execute a combo finish with cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble, overwhelming the opponent with a sudden surge of threats and game-ending plays.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through various counterspells, discard spells, and removal while deploying threats that are difficult to deal with. The deck aims to maintain card advantage and resource management to outvalue the opponent and win the game through attrition. With a combination of disruption, card draw, and powerful threats like Murktide Regent, the deck seeks to control the board and dictate the pace of the game until it can secure victory.

This deck aims to flood the board with artifacts and use them to generate mana and draw cards quickly. By playing low-cost artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble, combined with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga, the deck can quickly establish a strong board presence and overwhelm opponents with efficient threats. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruption spells like Metallic Rebuke, the deck can quickly race opponents and disrupt their game plan, making it a powerful and versatile Aggro - Affinity archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The key idea of this deck is to utilize the synergy between the Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly ramp up mana and search for key lands such as Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige. By using cards like Scapeshift and Explore, the deck can quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces to generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelm the opponent with powerful land-based abilities. The combination of land tutoring, ramping, and searching allows the deck to consistently execute its game plan and put pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, then bring them back into play using reanimation spells like Unearth and Persist. The deck focuses on using creatures such as Psychic Frog, Emperor of Bones, Archon of Cruelty, and Abhorrent Oculus to overwhelm and outvalue the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the game and protect the combo. The win condition is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and close out the game quickly.

The main strategy of this UrzaTron Control deck is to quickly assemble Urza's Tower, Urza's Mine, and Urza's Power Plant to generate large amounts of mana and play powerful Eldrazi creatures. The deck aims to control the board with spells like Karn, the Great Creator and Thought-Knot Seer while disrupting the opponent with cards like Kozilek's Command and Dismember. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and All Is Dust provide board wipes and additional control options, making it difficult for the opponent to establish a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to combo off quickly with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift, searching for key lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures to generate powerful advantages. The deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and potent spells. With a mix of land tutors, mana acceleration, and the ability to create multiple land drops in a single turn, the deck aims to win the game through big swings and powerful combos.
